name: avra
description: Assembler for the Atmel AVR microcontroller family

repo.name: avra
repo.description: Assembler for the Atmel AVR microcontroller family

readme.summary: Clear purpose but lacks practical examples and usage guidance, relegating critical information to separate files.
readme.top_issue: No quick start example or basic usage demonstration in main README—users must navigate to separate USAGE.md file to learn how to actually use the tool after installation

injection_risks.description: Use of strcpy() function without checking the length of the source string, potentially leading to buffer overflow.
Use of sprintf() equivalent (strftime()) with user-controlled data, potentially leading to format string vulnerability.

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in strcpy() function.
Potential format string vulnerability in strftime() function.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Missing support for newer AVR microcontrollers (ATtiny1614, ATmega324A, etc.)
Outdated package in mainstream Linux repositories
Parsing bugs (.db directive with quotes, parenthesis whitespace requirements)
Missing debug symbol support for gdb
Limited maintainer availability and slow PR review
sentiment.summary: The avra project shows severe abandonment signals with 13 open issues spanning multiple years, zero maintainer engagement, critical bugs unfixed, and explicit requests for additional maintainers due to sporadic availability.

red_flags: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
Lack of clear guidance for minor contributions
communication.summary: The maintainer provides detailed explanations but could be more welcoming and clearer about small tasks.

concerns: No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The avra package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for over 6 months despite 37 unresolved open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is comprehensive but lacks clear categorization, marking of breaking changes, and migration guides.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package's features and compatibility, but lacks clear installation instructions and examples for common use cases.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months
Low number of commits and closed issues
Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and quick start example
Community: lack of support for new AVR UCs
Communication: Occasional dismissive tone towards new contributors
Communication: Lack of clear guidance for minor contributions
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in strcpy() function.
Security: Potential format string vulnerability in strftime() function.
